column1: 27% of all customers churned — a significant portion that affects long-term revenue.
Churned customers pay higher monthly charges (avg $74.44) compared to non-churned ($61.27).
This suggests price sensitivity and bill shock as major churn drivers.
Fiber optic users churn the most despite being a premium service, likely due to higher monthly charges, performance expectations, or service dissatisfaction.
0–1 Year customers make up 53% of churn
Churn decreases sharply after Year 1 ? stronger retention after they stay longer.
New customers (first 12 months) are most vulnerable and should be prioritized for onboarding, support, and early-life retention offers.
Month-to-month customers dominate churn, matching the insight that flexible contracts equal low commitment.
Encouraging 1–2 year contracts may significantly reduce churn.
